required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validating TEE Measurements of Right Ventricular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Validating Transesophageal Echocardiographic Measurements of Right Ventricular Function

brief_summary.textblock:
Transesophageal echocardiography (TEE) is becoming a more prevalent method of monitoring and diagnosis in the perioperative setting for critically ill patients and patients undergoing cardiac surgery. Many TEE measurements are extrapolated from transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) data and have not validated by transesophageal means. The aim of this study is to validate TEE assessment of right ventricular function by comparing them to simultaneously measured TTE measurements.
Likewise, there are currently no agreed upon values for RV free wall strain. Therefore, the investigators will attempt to define a range of normal values of RV free wall strain as compared to the other measures of RV function.

detailed_description.textblock: Traditionally, all echocardiographic measurements have been studied utilizing TTE. Therefore the normal values and ranges for pathology findings have been defined by transthoracic means alone. TEE offers different images planes when compared to TTE, which may make the measurements obtained differ from those obtained by TTE. In the operating room environment the vast majority of echocardiography is completed by transesophageal means for many reasons; largely access to the patient and the continuous use of TEE as a hemodynamic monitor. However, given the fact that most echocardiographic measurements have only been validated by TTE, there remains a question as to the validity or precision of TEE-derived measurements.

primary_outcome.measure: Right ventricular index of myocardial performance (RIMP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the induction of anesthesia and TEE probe placement
primary_outcome.description: Right ventricular index of myocardial performance (RIMP) will be measured using both TTE and TEE.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the induction of anesthesia and TEE probe placement
primary_outcome.description: Tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion (TAPSE) will be measured using both TTE and TEE.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the induction of anesthesia and TEE probe placement
primary_outcome.description: Right ventricular fractional area change (FAC) will be measured using both TTE and TEE.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the induction of anesthesia and TEE probe placement
primary_outcome.description: RV annular systolic velocity (S`) will be measured using both TTE and TEE.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the induction of anesthesia and TEE probe placement
primary_outcome.description: RV free wall longitudinal strain will be measured using both TTE and TEE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of obtaining appropriate TEE measures of right ventricular function
secondary_outcome.description: Ease of acquisition will be assessed by the echocardiographers

secondary_outcome.measure: Define values for normal right ventricular free wall strain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an estimate of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The data collected will be used to define normal values for right ventricular free wall strain

intervention.description: TEE measures of right ventricular function
TTE measures of right ventricular function

study_pop.textblock: All patients undergoing elective cardiac surgery, which as a standard of care, requires transesophageal echocardiography.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients undergoing elective cardiac surgery requiring TEE
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who do not wish to consent
- Patients with contraindications to TEE
- Urgent or emergent cardiac surgery
- Patients with preexisting open chest
- Patients with intrathoracic hardware (VAD, thoracostomy tube, etc)
- Non-English speaking subjects
- Cognitively impaired adults
- Pregnancy
